      • receive

        public int receive(java.nio.ByteBuffer dst)
        Retrieves the data from next message that is ready to be delivered to the application.

        This is the regular Mocket style receive.

        Parameters:
        dst - The buffer into wich bytes are to be transferred
        Returns:
        The number of bytes read, possibly zero, or -1 if the channel has reached end-of-stream

      • send

        public int send(boolean reliable,
                boolean sequenced,
                java.nio.ByteBuffer src)
        Enqueues the specified data for transmission.

        This is the regular Mocket style send.

        Parameters:
        reliable - Select the type of flow: reliable (true) or unreliable (false).
        sequenced - Select the type of flow: sequenced (true) or unsequenced (false).
        src - The buffer from wich bytes are to be retrieved
        Returns:
        The number of bytes written, possibly zero

      • send

        public int send(boolean reliable,
                boolean sequenced,
                java.nio.ByteBuffer src,
                int tag,
                short priority,
                long enqueueTimeout,
                long retryTimeout)
        Enqueues the specified data for transmission.

        This is the regular Mocket style send.

        Parameters:
        reliable - Select the type of flow: reliable (true) or unreliable (false).
        sequenced - Select the type of flow: sequenced (true) or unsequenced (false).
        src - The buffer from wich bytes are to be retrieved
        tag - Used to identify the type of the packet.
        priority - Indicates the priority of the packet. The range of priority values is 0-255. Default value = 5.
        enqueueTimeout - Indicates the length of time in milliseconds for which the method will wait if there is no room in the outgoing buffer (a zero value indicates wait forever). Default value = 0.
        retryTimeout - Indicates the length of time for which the transmitter will retransmit the packet to ensure successful delivery (a zero value indicates retry with no time limit). Default value = 0.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes written, possibly zero

        public int write(java.nio.ByteBuffer src)

        public long write(java.nio.ByteBuffer[] srcs)

      • implCloseSelectableChannel

        protected void implCloseSelectableChannel()
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Closes this selectable channel.

        This method is invoked by the close method in order to perform the actual work of closing the channel. This method is only invoked if the channel has not yet been closed, and it is never invoked more than once.

        An implementation of this method must arrange for any other thread that is blocked in an I/O operation upon this channel to return immediately, either by throwing an exception or by returning normally.

        Specified by:
        implCloseSelectableChannel in class java.nio.channels.spi.AbstractSelectableChannel
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • implConfigureBlocking

        protected void implConfigureBlocking(boolean block)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Adjusts this channel's blocking mode.

        This method is invoked by the configureBlocking method in order to perform the actual work of changing the blocking mode. This method is only invoked if the new mode is different from the current mode.

        Specified by:
        implConfigureBlocking in class java.nio.channels.spi.AbstractSelectableChannel
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs
